page.title: 10BERKELEY POWER STATION (2)
page.content: The nuclear power station has been the source of much{local and national {controversy}throughout its troubled history. It is not liked due to fears of {leaking radioactive gasses}into the atmosphere and the pouring of possibly {contaminated matter}into the River Severn. Recently parents of Lydney children were invited to tour the station hoping to quosh anxieties about such issues. (Lydney is on the opposite river bank to the station and has an increased occurance of {leukeamia).}Every month nuclear waste is transported through the nearby town of Berkeley. Until a few years ago it was shipped out from the nearby port of Sharpness, this has now stopped due to the efforts of{Greenpeace}and {Friends of the Earth,}two conservation movements.
